item.title: Booz Allen Invests in Machine Identity Firm Corsha
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
‘Machine identities’, often used interchangeably with ‘non-human identities’ (NHIs), have been increasing rapidly since the start of digital transformation.

The post Booz Allen Invests in Machine Identity Firm Corsha appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Millions of Cars Exposed to Remote Hacking via PerfektBlue Attack
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
PCA Cyber Security has discovered critical vulnerabilities in the BlueSDK Bluetooth stack that could have allowed remote code execution on car systems.

The post Millions of Cars Exposed to Remote Hacking via PerfektBlue Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: What Can Businesses Do About Ethical Dilemmas Posed by AI?
item.dc:creator: Stu Sjouwerman
item.description:
AI-made decisions are in many ways shaping and governing human lives. Companies have a moral, social, and fiduciary duty to responsibly lead its take-up.

The post What Can Businesses Do About Ethical Dilemmas Posed by AI? appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: AirMDR Raises $15.5 Million for MDR Solution
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
AI-powered MDR provider AirMDR has raised $15.5 million in funding (seed and infusion investment) to support its R&D efforts.

The post AirMDR Raises $15.5 Million for MDR Solution appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Nippon Steel Subsidiary Blames Data Breach on Zero-Day Attack
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Nippon Steel Solutions has disclosed a data breach that resulted from the exploitation of a zero-day in network equipment.

The post Nippon Steel Subsidiary Blames Data Breach on Zero-Day Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Samsung Announces Security Improvements for Galaxy Smartphones
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
New Samsung Galaxy features include protections for on-device AI, expanded cross-device threat detection, and quantum-resistant encryption for network security.

The post Samsung Announces Security Improvements for Galaxy Smartphones appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: ICS Patch Tuesday: Vulnerabilities Addressed by Siemens, Schneider, Phoenix Contact
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Industrial solutions providers Siemens, Schneider Electric and Phoenix Contact have released July 2025 Patch Tuesday ICS security advisories.

The post ICS Patch Tuesday: Vulnerabilities Addressed by Siemens, Schneider, Phoenix Contact appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Unpatched Ruckus Vulnerabilities Allow Wireless Environment Hacking
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Multiple vulnerabilities in Ruckus Wireless management products could be exploited to fully compromise the managed environments.

The post Unpatched Ruckus Vulnerabilities Allow Wireless Environment Hacking appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Canadian Electric Utility Says Power Meters Disrupted by Cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Nova Scotia Power is notifying individuals affected by the recent data breach, including in the United States.

The post Canadian Electric Utility Says Power Meters Disrupted by Cyberattack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Ivanti, Fortinet, Splunk Release Security Updates
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Ivanti, Fortinet, and Splunk have released patches for critical- and high-severity vulnerabilities in their products.

The post Ivanti, Fortinet, Splunk Release Security Updates appeared first on SecurityWeek.
